attributes.action: Use the £29.5m given to councils to to pay for staff to police the smoking ban for something more constructive and needed instead
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Ministers have given councils £29.5m to train council staff to police the smoking ban in bars, restaurants and shops in England. 
They will be able to give on-the-spot £50 fines to individuals and take court action against premises when the smoking ban is introduced in England.

No such measures seem to have been required in Scotland, Ireland or other countries imposing similar bans!

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
